RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Engenheiro Florestal e Mestre em Cincias pela Universidade de So Paulo, com tese sobre Ecologia de Ecossistema Florestal usando a avifauna como bioindicador em ambientes da Mata Atlntica. Fez Extenso Universitria na Universit di Pisa, Itlia, em projeto cientfico com Biovalorizao de Resduos Orgnicos coordenado pelo Institut National Polytechnique de Toulouse, Frana (ALFA Program, European Commission). Recebeu o ttulo de Philosophiae Doctor (PhD) em Agricultura e Ambiente, com nfase em Ecofisiologia de Plantas Arbreas pela Scuola Superiore di Studi Universitari e di Perfezionamento Sant'Anna di Pisa, Itlia, em 2006, ttulo reconhecido pela Universidade de So Paulo como Doutor em Agronomia, rea de Fitotecnia. Publicou 46 artigos em jornais e peridicos especializados, 57 trabalhos em anais de eventos e um eBook. Possui 1 software e outros 662 itens de produo tcnica, assessoria e consultoria. Participou de 32 eventos no exterior e 66 no Brasil. Recebeu 4 prmios como pesquisador. Participou de 12 projetos de pesquisa em meio ambiente. Atua na rea de Ecologia, com nfase em Etnobiologia e Conservao da Natureza, realizando pesquisas e executando trabalhos tcnicos para licenciamento ambiental com caracterizao da vegetao e diagnstico da fauna silvestre em Estudo de Componente Indgena (ECI), Estudos de Impacto Ambiental (EIA), Relatrio de Controle Ambiental (RCA), Avaliao Ambiental Estratgica (AAE) e Avaliao Ambiental e Social (Environmental and Social Due Diligence). Em suas atividades profissionais interagiu com 56 colaboradores em coautorias de trabalhos cientficos.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Engenharia Florestal - Esalq from Universidade de So Paulo (1992), master's at Forest Resources and Forest Engineering from Universidade de So Paulo (1999) and doctorate at Ecofisiologia delle Piante Arboree from Scuola Superiore di Studi Universitari e di Perfezionamento Sant'Anna (2005). Has experience in Ecologia, focusing on Conservao da Natureza, acting on the following subjects: ecossistema, conservao, mata atlntica, manejo and avifauna.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Fabio Rossano Dario, born in Piracicaba, State of So Paulo, Brazil, in 1964 December 10th, married. Forest Engineer and Magister Scientia by Universidade de So Paulo, Brazil, I wrote a thesis on habitat management in the Atlantic Rainforest, using the avifauna as an ecological indicator. Doctor by Scuola Superiore Sant'Anna, Pisa, Italy, I wrote a thesis on physiology of arboreal plants. I developed and published several scientific researches in the area of genetic improvement, agroforestry systems, monitoring of ecosystems, evaluation of environmental impacts, organic agriculture and conservation and preservation of biodiversity, in Scrub Savanna, Atlantic and Amazon Rainforest, working with research institutes, enterprises, non governmental organizations and universities, gaining 15 years of experience as researcher and technician-scientific coordinator of several works in Brazil. I have good knowledge in Portuguese, Italian, Spanish, and English, and Statistical Analysis System. Lecturer of the University of So Paulo, in the disciplines "Conservation of Nature" and "Management of Wild Fauna", from 1994 to 2000. Founding Member of Escola de Governo e Cidadania (School of Government and citizenship), executive and researcher manager of the Instituto de Pesquisas e Estudos da Vida Silvestre (Institute of Wild Life Research), technical coordinator of the Instituto de Pesquisas e Estudos Florestais (Institute of Forestry Research), consultant in environmental subjects by World Bank, Petrobras, Cia. Vale do Rio Doce, Amazon Vigilance System Project, Administrao das Hidrovias da Amaznia Oriental (Administration of Hydroway in the Oriental Amazon), Biomtrica (Biological Evaluations and Environmental Management), and participated as scientific researcher in the international program of cooperation ?Alpha Program? of Rseau Atlantis, integrating into the project "Evaluation of effects of organic composts in sugar-cane crop?.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Sub-projeto 1A: Mapeamento, qualificaes e tipologias das vegetaes naturais e implantadas;
Sub-projeto 2A: Levantamento e anlise da avifauna das reservas naturais;
Sub-projeto 3A: Levantamento florstico das reservas naturais;
Sub-projeto 4A: Levantamento e anlise da mastofauna das reservas naturais;
Sub-projeto 5A: Levantamento fitossociolgico das reservas naturais;
Sub-projeto 6A: Levantamento e anlise da herpetofauna das reservas naturais;
Sub-projeto 1B: Estudo da distribuio, tamanhos, formas e coberturas das reservas naturais, visando a conservao da vida silvestre e o manejo integrado de pragas;
Sub-projeto 2B: Estudo de espcies florestais e alternativas de manejo, visando o melhoramento de habitats e a implantao de pontes florestais ligando as reservas naturais.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de fragmentos da mata atlntica utilizando-se a avifauna como indicador ecolgico
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: O estudo foi realizado em rea localizada na Serra do Mar, no domnio da Mata Atlntica, municpio de Paraibuna, estado de So Paulo, Brasil. Foram estudados trs fragmentos de vegetao natural e uma rea de plantio de eucalipto adjacente. O fragmento de menor rea constitui-se num corredor de vegetao natural, interligando os dois fragmentos maiores. O principal objetivo foi analisar os grupos de aves afetados pela fragmentao florestal e avaliar os impactos causados pela fragmentao e o isolamento destas reas e, utilizando a avifauna como indicador ecolgico, analisar a efetividade do corredor na passagem de material gentico entre os fragmentos. Os mtodos utilizados para o registro da avifauna foram o de observaes por pontos fixos e captura e recaptura com auxilio de redes instaladas no sub-bosque dos fragmentos e do plantio de eucalipto.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity and trophic structure of birds in forest fragments in the metropolitan area of So Paulo, Brazil

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Scholars Journal of Agriculture and Veterinary Sciences

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: The diversity of birds is directly correlated with the structure of the forest. The fragmentation of forest, i.e., the disruption in the continuity of forest habitat cover can cause impacts on bird?s abundance, species richness, and community dynamics. Any interfering with the vegetation produces direct effects on the avifauna through the increase, decrease, or alternation of two key attributes: food and shelter. So, the composition of life in the forest is altered as changes occur in vegetation that directly interferes with the population structure of the avifauna, be those changes natural or anthropic. This study realized in forest fragments of Atlantic Forest in a metropolitan area of So Paulo, Brazil, was to analyze the groups of birds that were affected by the forest fragmentation in different stages of ecological succession and the results show alterations in the diversity and density of bird?s species, principally among specialist species.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity of frugivorous and omnivorous birds in different stages of ecological succession in Amazon Rainforest fragments

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: ABSTRACT: The diversity of birds is directly correlated with the structure of the forest. Any interfering with the vegetation produces direct effects on the avifauna through the increase, decrease, or alternation of two key attributes: food and shelter. So, the composition of life in the forest is altered as changes occur in vegetation that directly interferes with the population structure of the avifauna, be those changes natural or anthropic. This study was realized in Amazon Rainforest fragments, and the main objective was to analyze the behavior of frugivorous and omnivorous birds in three different stages of ecological succession. In forest environments, where a vertical stratification of resources occurs, these species are distributed occupying a high diversity of trophic niches. The diversity and density of the frugivorous and omnivorous birds in the forest fragments in medium and advanced stage of ecological succession could be directly correlated not only with the structure of the forest but also to the fact that these birds feed almost exclusively on abundant and easy to find food source: shrub and tree fruit of certain vegetable species abundant in rainforest understory layer.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Traditional knowledge of the wild mammals and their ecological interactions by community indigenous Apiak, Southern Brazilian Amazon Rainforest

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Apiak indigenous on the mammals of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in the Mato Grosso State, Southern Brazilian Amazon Rainforest. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twelve indigenous were interviewed, with both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 36 different species of mammals and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these animals. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: ESTUDO FITOSSOCILGICO DE UMA REA DE CAATINGA EM ESTGIO INICIAL DE SUCESSO ECOLGICA NO ESTADO DA PARABA, BRASIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Phytossociological study od Caatinga vegetation in initial stage of ecological succession in Paraba State, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este estudo foi realizado em rea inserida no ecossistema Savana-Estpica Arborizada, do bioma Caatinga, localizada no municpio de Campina Grande, estado da Paraba. O objetivo deste estudo foi conhecer a composio florstica e a estrutura da vegetao atravs de estudo florstico e inventrio florestal em oito parcelas de 10 x 40 m, onde foram mensuradas todas as rvores e arbustos com dimetro ao nvel do solo > 2 cm e altura > 100 cm. Foram calculados parmetros fitossociolgicos, ndices de Shannon (H?) e equitabilidade de Pielou (J). O estrato da vegetao predominante o arbustivo, com alturas variando entre 1 e 2 m, com presena de rvores emergentes, cuja altura mxima de 5 m. A rea basal total foi de 2,94 m2.ha-1. A fitossociologia registrou uma diversidade baixa de espcies (n=20), com o valor de Shannon H?=1,89 nats.ind-1. As espcies vegetais de maior densidade foram Mimosa tenuiflora, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis, Croton heliotropiifolius, Jatropha mutabilis e Piptadenia stipulacea. As espcies com maior valor de importncia foram Mimosa tenuiflora, Ziziphus joazeiro, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis e Commiphora leptophloeos. A florstica registrou 65 espcies, entre rvores, arbustos, ervas, lianas e epfitas. Com os resultados concluiu-se que a vegetao encontra-se no estgio inicial de sucesso ecolgica com diferentes graus de antropizao.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This study was carried out in an area inserted in the Savana-Estpica ecosystem, part of the bioma Caatinga, and it is located near the town of Campina Grande, State of Paraba, Brazil. The aim of this study was to describe the floristic composition and the structure of the vegetation through floristic studies and forest inventory. It was studied eight sampling plots of 10 x 40 meters, where were measured all trees and shrubs with stem diameter at soil level > 2 cm and height > 100 cm. It was calculated the phytosociological parameters, indexes of Shannon (H?) and Pielou equability (J). The predominant layer in the vegetation is the shrub, with heights ranging from one to two meters, and trees whose maximum height is of 5 meters. The total basal area was 2.94 m2.ha-1. The phytossociological study registered a low diversity of species (n=20). The Shannon?s index was H?=1.89 nats.ind-1. The species of highest value of importance were Mimosa tenuiflora, Ziziphus joazeiro, Croton blanchetianus, Poincianella pyramidalis, and Commiphora leptophloeos. The floristic study registered 65 species, among trees, shrubs, herbs, vines and epiphytes. Therefore, with the results it was concluded that the vegetation is in the initial stage of ecological succession with different degrees of human impact.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Uso de plantas da caatinga pelo povo indgena Pankararu no Estado de Pernambuco, Brasil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: The use of plants of the Brazilian caatinga biome by the indigenous Pankararu in Pernambuco State, Brazil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste estudo de etnobotnica realizado em territrios indgenas Pankararu, localizados no interior do estado de Pernambuco, Brasil, constatou-se, atravs de entrevistas, a utilizao de 87 espcies vegetais e duas liqunicas, sendo a maioria de ocorrncia natural do bioma Caatinga e outras introduzidas para diversas finalidades, como medicinal, alimento, artesanato, lenha, utenslios e construes em geral. O objetivo deste estudo foi realizar um levantamento do conhecimento que os Pankararu possuem sobre a vegetao existente nos seus territrios. O conhecimento das plantas e a relao do homem com a natureza no so passados e nem aprendidos de maneira sistemtica e formal entre estes indgenas e so poucos os detentores destes conhecimentos. A grande variedade de espcies vegetais registradas demonstrou que o uso das plantas bem abrangente. Calculou-se o ndice de Significado Cultural de cada planta. As espcies de maior significado cultural so na maioria nativas, geralmente de uso medicinal para diferentes tratamentos, como Neoglaziovia variegata, Caesalpinia pyramidalis, Spondias tuberosa, Baccharis sylvestris, Commiphora leptophloeos, Syagrus coronata, Aspidosperma pyrifolium, Hyptis pectinata, Lippia macrophylla, Jatropha pohliana, Pithecellobium avaremotemo e Sideroxylon obtusifolium, demonstrando a importncia das espcies vegetais da Caatinga na sobrevivncia cultural e ecolgica dos Pankararu.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this ethnobotany study accomplished in the Pankararu indigenous territories, located in the State of Pernambuco, Brazil, through interviews was verified the use of 87 plant species and two lichen species, being most part of natural occurrence of the biome Caatinga and the others introduced for several purposes, such as medicine, food, handicrafts, firewood, utensils and buildings in general. The objective of this study was to accomplish a gathering of the knowledge that Pankararu possess about the vegetation of their territories. The knowledge of the plants and man's relationship with the nature neither are passed or learned in a systematic or formal way among these natives, there are few that holden theese knowledge. The great variety of registered plant species demonstrated that the use of the plants is comprehensive. The Cultural Significance Index of each plant was calculated. The species of most cultural significance are native, usually of medicinal use for different health treatments, as Neoglaziovia variegata, Caesalpinia pyramidalis, Spondias tuberosa, Baccharis sylvestris, Commiphora leptophloeos, Syagrus coronata, Aspidosperma pyrifolium, Hyptis pectinata, Lippia macrophylla, Jatropha pohliana, Pithecellobium avaremotemo e Sideroxylon obtusifolium, showing the importance of Caatinga species in the cultural and ecological survival of the Pankararu.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity of birds and their ecological interactions in the Mura Indigenous Territory, Brazilian Amazon Rainforest

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Natalia Livramento da Silva de Oliveira

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Mura indigenous on the birds of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in the Amazonas State, Brazilian Amazon Rainforest. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty four indigenous were interviewed, with both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 118 different species of birds, counting about 60% of the records, which in addition to the interviews was completed by surveying the bird by direct field observations with sighting and vocalization in different natural environments of the indigenous territory. The indigenous showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these birds. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: CONHECIMENTO TRADICIONAL DA AVIFAUNA PELOS INDGENAS KAYABI, AMAZNIA MERIDIONAL, BRASIL
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: CONHECIMENTO TRADICIONAL DA AVIFAUNA PELOS INDGENAS KAYABI, AMAZNIA MERIDIONAL, BRASIL

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este estudo teve como objetivo um levantamento do conhecimento que os indgenas Kayabi possuem sobre a avifauna de ocorrncia natural na Terra Indgena Kayabi, localizada na Amaznia, entre os estados do Par e Mato Grosso, Brasil. Para coleta de dados foram realizadas entrevistas com vinte e dois indgenas que citaram 165 espcies de aves e mostraram amplo conhecimento ecolgico sobre estas aves, incluindo categorias relacionadas morfologia, hbitos alimentares, hbitats e vocalizao.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Kayabi indigenous on the birds of natural occurrence in their territory, who is located in Amazon Rainforest, between the states Par and Mato Grosso, Brazil. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty two indigenous were interviewed. The interviewees mentioned 165 different species of birds and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these birds.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: The relationship between Bororo Indigenous and the wildlife in the Brazilian Savannah

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study was accomplishes a knowledge survey of the Bororo indigenous on the mammals of natural occurrence in their territory, Meruri village, who is located in the Mato Grosso State, Brazil, in the Savannah biome, and also the relationship of the indigenous with these wild animals. As method for collect the data were used open and semi-structured interviews. Twenty-two indigenous were interviewed, both genres and different ages. The interviewees mentioned 37 species of mammals and they showed wide ecological knowledge regarding these animals. Such relationships are complex, being evidenced a mythical interaction between the man and the elements of nature. The oral transmission of knowledge occurs across generations.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Diversity and trophic structure of bird's communities in Brazilian Savanna areas of the Cuiab River basin

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolgico

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Fauna como Indicador Biolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
We analyzed the differences in composition, richness, and abundance of birds in different forest fragments of the Brazilian Savanna in the Cuiab River basin, Mato Grosso State, Brazil, and we
demonstrated the variations in richness and abundance of birds between different trophic guilds. We
used point counts to characterize the avifauna. Sampling was conducted in two seasons: summer and
winter of 2018 in a total of 36 hours distributed in 108 samples. A total of 743 contacts were obtained
belonging to 87 bird species distributed among 17 orders and 33 families and categorized in 16 trophic
guilds. The omnivorous and insectivorous birds composed most of the community. For each species, we
calculated the abundance index value that showed our study site had a large number of species with low
index and few species with intermediate to high index compared to the pattern observed in other surveys. Our study area was characterized by high species diversity for both periods studied. The Shannon-Weaver diversity index for our study areas was 3.90 for the summer period and 3.77 for the winter period. Equitability was high, 0.82 for the summer period and 0.79 for the winter period, suggesting the number of species registered in our study site represented the maximum capacity the areas can shelter. Our results show that despite being a secondary and fragmented forest the study area was characterized by a diverse avian community. The ciliary forest studied that follows the Cuiab River, although fragmented and isolated by extensive degraded areas and occupied by pastures and agricultural crops, they are important natural environments to maintain bird diversity.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.TITULO: Xingu River?s Big Bend: great diversity of birds in the Brazilian Amazon rainforest

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRA-PRODUCAO.EDITORA: The Institute of Biopaleogeography named under Charles R. Darwin

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Estudo da Avifauna como Indicador Ecolgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This report is a photographic summary of a study carried out during 2019 in a region called Xingu River?s Big Bend, in the Brazilian Amazon. There were a total of five scientific expeditions to study the environmental impacts of a project in the region and more specifically the possible interferences in the life of the indigenous inhabitants of the region and those who live in harmony with the environment. The photos show the Xingu River, the riparian forest where the study was carried out and some of the bird species registered.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A campanha piloto, realizada entre os municpios de Sinop e Cladia no estado do Mato Grosso, teve como objetivos fundamentais o entendimento da estrutura das formaes vegetais encontradas no Estado de Mato Grosso, visando a elaborao de modelos prognsticos para a vegetao, com nfase nos projetos de desenvolvimento auto-sustentado.
Coordenao dos trabalhos: ESALQ, USP - Universidade de So Paulo e UNICAMP - Universidade Estadual de Campinas

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Reflorestamento de rea para o cultivo de eucalipto.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Coordenao tcnica do EIA-RIMA de uma rea de 3.000 ha para instalao de um plantio de eucaliptos visando a produo de madeira destinada serraria, celulose, estacas, escoramentos, carvo vegetal e outros produtos obtidos a partir desta matria prima.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Expanso dos plantios florestais em area de 6 micro-bacias.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O principal objetivo do empreendimento o plantio de eucalipto numa rea de aproximadamente 44 mil ha para atender a manuteno da auto-suficincia de produo de madeira de eucalipto para a fbrica de celulose instalada no municpio de Guaba-RS.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: Avaliao de viabilidade tcnico-econmico-ambiental de jazidas de potssio no estado do Amazonas

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.INSTITUICAO-FINANCIADORA: Petrobras, Progen, Ecosplan, Logit, JGP, Multigeo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Trabalho integrante de um conjunto de estudos destinados ao fornecimento de subsdios para se proceder avaliao de viabilidade tcnico-econmico-ambiental de jazidas de potssio para a Petrleo Brasileiro S.A. - PETROBRAS. O presente estudo contemplou a avaliao dos impactos scio-ambientais do empreendimento correspondente s jazidas de potssio de Arari e Fazendinha, localizadas no municpio de Itacoatiara e Nova Olinda do Norte, no Estado do Amazonas.
